thread.title: People with lapsed auto insurance coverage to receive warning le
thread.title_full: People with lapsed auto insurance coverage to receive warning le - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: People with lapsed auto insurance coverage to receive warning le
text:
More than a million drivers with lapsed insurance coverage in Louisiana can expect to get warning letters in the mail.
The Louisiana Office of Motor Vehicles sent the letters, warning people that a collections agency might be used if fines go unpaid. The mail blast is the first effort by the OMV to capitalize on a new provision of a law allowing the department to collect money through the Office of Debt Recovery.
Critics call the tactic a money grab. Head of Louisiana State Police Col. Mike Edmundson calls the effort a honest effort to recoup liabilities owed.
The OMV hopes to collect $444 million dollars in outstanding debts.
